sentences.english: No one who knew him would tax him with affectation.
sentences.chinese: 真確認識他的人不會責備他矯揉做作。

sentences.english: I declare that the information provided above is true and correct.
sentences.chinese: 本人聲明，上述所填報的資料均屬真確無訛。

sentences.english: This declaration is true to the best of my knowledge and belief.
sentences.chinese: 盡本人所知所信，本聲明乃真確無誤。

sentences.english: Twice is this true of the soul of a nation.
sentences.chinese: 以言一國之精神，倍加真確。

sentences.english: I certify that all information given in the Project Proposal is true and accurate.
sentences.chinese: 本人證實，本計劃建議書所載的資料真確無訛。

sentences.english: I declare that all information provided in this Enrollment form is, to the best of my knowledge, accurate and complete.
sentences.chinese: 本人聲明於本報名表所提供資料均屬真確，並無遺漏。

sentences.english: This is especially true regarding to your reputation and influence.
sentences.chinese: 這在名譽和影響力方面尤其真確。

sentences.english: What is the true camera to take it?
sentences.chinese: 什麼樣拿相機纔是真確的呢？

sentences.english: I certify that all the information given in this project proposal is true and accurate.
sentences.chinese: 在本計劃建議書填報的資料均屬真確無訛。

sentences.english: It is not true that there is starvation in the rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 但這是不真確的有飢餓，在農村地區。

sentences.english: I certify that all the information given in this application is true and accurate.
sentences.chinese: 本人保證在本申請表格填報的資料均屬真確無訛。

sentences.english: This is particularly true in the challenge of following Jesus Christ.
sentences.chinese: 面對跟隨耶穌基督的挑戰時，這一點尤其真確。

sentences.english: All of the information in this application form is correct to the best of my knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 據本人所知，此申請表內的資料全屬真確。

sentences.english: The truth of an opinion is part of its utility.
sentences.chinese: 一個意見的真確性正是其功利性的一部分。

sentences.english: This is especially true with temptation.
sentences.chinese: 抗拒它等於強化了它，這事在試探上特別真確。

definition: lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
hard to distinguish real from imitation
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
pavilion in the air (idiom); unrealistic Utopian construction/castles in Spain/imaginary future plans
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to turn a blind eye to
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to follow blindly (idiom)/to take as one's only guide
